lyrics: How gentle Godâs commands! How kind his precepts are! Come, cast your burdens on the Lord And trust his constant care.
Beneath his watchful eye, His Saints securely dwell; That hand which bears all nature up Shall guard his children well.
Why should this anxious load Press down your weary mind? Haste to your Heavânly Fatherâs throne And sweet refreshment find.
His goodness stands approved, Unchanged from day to day; Iâll drop my burden at his feet And bear a song away.

title: Jesus, the Very Thought of Thee (Women)
lyrics: Jesus, the very thought of thee With sweetness fills my breast; But sweeter far thy face to see And in thy presence rest.
Nor voice can sing, nor heart can frame, Nor can the memâry find A sweeter sound than thy blest name, O Savior of mankind!
O hope of evâry contrite heart, O joy of all the meek, To those who fall, how kind thou art! How good to those who seek!
Jesus, our only joy be thou, As thou our prize wilt be; Jesus, be thou our glory now, And thru eternity.

title: The Lord Is My Shepherd (Women)
lyrics: The Lord is my Shepherd; no want shall I know. I feed in green pastures; safe-folded I rest. He leadeth my soul where the still waters flow, Restores me when wandâring, redeems when oppressed, Restores me when wandâring, redeems when oppressed.

Thru the valley and shadow of death though I stray, Since thou art my Guardian, no evil I fear. Thy rod shall defend me, thy staff be my stay. No harm can befall with my Comforter near. No harm can befall with my Comforter near.

In the midst of affliction my table is spread. With blessings unmeasured my cup runneth oâer. With perfume and oil thou anointest my head. Oh, what shall I ask of thy providence more? Oh, what shall I ask of thy providence more?

title: Sweet Is the Work (Women)
lyrics: Sweet is the work, my God, my King, To praise thy name, give thanks and sing, To show thy love by morning light, And talk of all thy truths at night.
Sweet is the day of sacred rest. No mortal care shall seize my breast. Oh, may my heart in tune be found, Like Davidâs harp of solemn sound!
My heart shall triumph in my Lord And bless his works and bless his word. Thy works of grace, how bright they shine! How deep thy counsels, how divine!
But, oh, what triumph shall I raise To thy dear name through endless days, When in the realms of joy I see Thy face in full felicity!
Sin, my worst enemy before, Shall vex my eyes and ears no more. My inward foes shall all be slain, Nor Satan break my peace again.
Then shall I see and hear and know All I desired and wished below, And every powâr find sweet employ In that eternal world of joy.

title: Love at Home (Women)
lyrics: There is beauty all around When thereâs love at home; There is joy in evâry sound When thereâs love at home. Peace and plenty here abide, Smiling sweet on evâry side. Time doth softly, sweetly glide When thereâs love at home. Love at home, love at home; Time doth softly, sweetly glide When thereâs love at home.

In the cottage there is joy When thereâs love at home; Hate and envy neâer annoy When thereâs love at home. Roses bloom beneath our feet; All the earthâs a garden sweet, Making life a bliss complete When thereâs love at home. Love at home, love at home; Making life a bliss complete When thereâs love at home.

Kindly heaven smiles above When thereâs love at home; All the world is filled with love When thereâs love at home. Sweeter sings the brooklet by; Brighter beams the azure sky. Oh, thereâs One who smiles on high When thereâs love at home. Love at home, love at home; Oh, thereâs One who smiles on high When thereâs love at home.

title: Ye Elders of Israel (Men)
lyrics: Ye elders of Israel, come join now with me And seek out the righteous, whereâer they may beâ In desert, on mountain, on land, or on seaâ And bring them to Zion, the pure and the free. O Babylon, O Babylon, we bid thee farewell; Weâre going to the mountains of Ephraim to dwell.

The harvest is great, and the labârers are few; But if weâre united, we all things can do. Weâll gather the wheat from the midst of the tares And bring them from bondage, from sorrows and snares. O Babylon, O Babylon, we bid thee farewell; Weâre going to the mountains of Ephraim to dwell.

Weâll go to the poor, like our Captain of old, And visit the weary, the hungry, and cold; Weâll cheer up their hearts with the news that he bore And point them to Zion and life evermore. O Babylon, O Babylon, we bid thee farewell; Weâre going to the mountains of Ephraim to dwell.

title: The Priesthood of Our Lord (Men)
lyrics: Brethren, powâr by earthly standards Comes by rank or wealth or sword; But the powâr above all others Is the priesthood of our Lord.
It is ours, the total armorâ Priesthood held by Christ, our Lordâ If, as brethren, we are worthy Of the Spiritâs whispered word.
Let us venture forth in freedom With the priesthood as our guideâ Deacons, teachers, priests, and elders, Seeking virtue side by side.

title: Ye Who Are Called to Labor (Men)
lyrics: Ye who are called to labor and minister for God, Blest with the royal priesthood, appointed by his word To preach among the nations the news of gospel grace, And publish on the mountains salvation, truth, and peace:

Oh, let not vain ambition nor worldly glory stain Your minds so pure and holy; acquit yourselves like men. While lifting up your voices like trumpets long and loud, Say to the slumbâring nation: âPrepare to meet your God!â

Then cease from all light speeches, light-mindedness, and pride; Pray always without ceasing and in the truth abide. The Comforter will teach you, his richest blessings send. Your Savior will be with you forever to the end.

Rich blessings there await you, and God will give you faith. You shall be crowned with glory and triumph over death, And soon youâll come to Zion and, bearing each his sheaf, No more shall taste of sorrow, but glorious crowns receive.

title: Come, All Ye Sons of God (Men)
lyrics: Come, all ye sons of God who have received the priesthood; Go spread the gospel wide and gather in his people. The latter-day work has begun: To gather scattered Israel in And bring them back to Zion to praise the Lamb.

Come, all ye scattered sheep, and listen to your Shepherd, While you the blessings reap which long have been predicted. By prophets long itâs been foretold: Heâll gather you into his fold And bring you home to Zion to praise the Lamb.

Repent and be baptized, and have your sins remitted, And get the Spiritâs zeal; oh, then youâll be united. Go cast upon him all your care; He will regard your humble prayer And bring you home to Zion to praise the Lamb.

And when your grief is oâer and ended your affliction, Your spirits then will soar to await the Resurrection; And then his presence youâll enjoy, In heavânly bliss your time employ, A thousand years in Zion to praise the Lamb.

title: Rise Up, O Men of God (Menâs Choir)
lyrics: Rise up, O men of God! Have done with lesser things. Give heart and soul and mind and strength To serve the King of Kings. Rise up, O men of God, In one united throng. Bring in the day of brotherhood And end the night of wrong. Rise up, O men of God! Tread where his feet have trod. As brothers of the Son of Man, Rise up, O men of God! Rise up! Rise up! Rise up!

title: Rise Up, O Men of God (Men)
lyrics: Rise up, O men of God! Have done with lesser things. Give heart and soul and mind and strength To serve the King of Kings.
Rise up, O men of God, In one united throng. Bring in the day of brotherhood And end the night of wrong.
Rise up, O men of God! Tread where his feet have trod. As brothers of the Son of Man, Rise up, O men of God!

title: See the Mighty Priesthood Gathered (Menâs Choir)
lyrics: See the mighty priesthood gathered; Firm in serried ranks they standâ Son and father jointly serving, Gathered in from evâry land. Proud their voices blend together, Raising hymns to Fatherâs praise, Sending forth the gospel message As restored in latter days.

As to Seth his father, Adam, Powârful precepts did impart, Humbly each receives the message Spoken from a prophetâs heart. Line on line, truth is revealed, Till all darkness flees away In the face of perfect knowledge, Where celestial laws hold sway.

Come, ye sons, and walk uprightly, As your noble fathers trodâ Bearers of the Saviorâs priesthood, Holding firm the iron rodâ Till Satanâs powârs are vanquished, Bound in chains he conquered lies, And our glorious hallelujahs Loudly sound across the skies, And our glorious hallelujahs Loudly sound, loudly sound across the skies.

title: Come, Come, Ye Saints (Menâs Choir)
lyrics: Come, come, ye Saints, no toil nor labor fear; But with joy wend your way. Though hard to you this journey may appear, Grace shall be as your day. âTis better far for us to strive Our useless cares from us to drive; Do this, and joy your hearts will swellâ All is well! All is well!

Why should we mourn or think our lot is hard? âTis not so; all is right. Why should we think to earn a great reward If we now shun the fight? Gird up your loins; fresh courage take. Our God will never us forsake; And soon weâll have this tale to tellâ All is well! All is well!

Weâll find the place which God for us prepared, Far away in the West, Where none shall come to hurt or make afraid; There the Saints will be blessed. Weâll make the air with music ring, Shout praises to our God and King; Above the rest these words weâll tellâ All is well! All is well!

And should we die before our journeyâs through, Happy day! All is well! We then are free from toil and sorrow, too; With the just we shall dwell! But if our lives are spared again To see the Saints their rest obtain, Oh, how weâll make this chorus swellâ All is well! All is well!

title: Go, Ye Messengers of Heaven (Menâs Choir)
lyrics: Go, ye messengers of heaven, Chosen by divine command; Go and publish free salvation To a dark, benighted land.
Go to island, vale, and mountain; There fulfill the great command; Gather out the sons of Jacob To possess the promised land.
When your thousands all are gathered, And their prayers for you ascend, And the Lord has crowned with blessings All the labors of your hand,
Then the song of joy and transport Will from evâry land resound; Then the nations long in darkness By the Savior will be crowned.

title: An Angel from on High (Menâs Choir)
lyrics: An angel from on high The long, long silence broke; Descending from the sky, These gracious words he spoke: Lo! in Cumorahâs lonely hill A sacred record lies concealed. Lo! in Cumorahâs lonely hill A sacred record lies concealed.

Sealed by Moroniâs hand, It has for ages lain To wait the Lordâs command, From dust to speak again. It shall again to light come forth To usher in Christâs reign on earth. It shall again to light come forth To usher in Christâs reign on earth.

It speaks of Josephâs seed And makes the remnant known Of nations long since dead, Who once had dwelt alone. The fulness of the gospel, too, Its pages will reveal to view. The fulness of the gospel, too, Its pages will reveal to view.

The time is now fulfilled, The long-expected day; Let earth obedience yield And darkness flee away. Remove the seals; be wide unfurled Its light and glory to the world. Remove the seals; be wide unfurled Its light and glory to the world.

Lo! Israel filled with joy Shall now be gathered home, Their wealth and means employ To build Jerusalem, While Zion shall arise and shine And fill the earth with truth divine. While Zion shall arise and shine And fill the earth with truth divine.

title: Thy Servants Are Prepared (Menâs Choir)
lyrics: Thy servants are prepared To teach thy word abroad, To gather in thy sheep To thee, O Lamb of God.
Let these, thy servants, speak With heart and voice of youth, And fill the worldâs dark lamps With light, the flame of truth.
In all of Zionâs stakes Thy love shall conquer night, While darkness draws away From thy revealing light.

title: See, the Mighty Angel Flying (Menâs Choir)
lyrics: See, the mighty angel flying; See, he speeds his way to earth To proclaim the blessed gospel And restore the ancient faith, And restore, and restore the ancient faith.
Hear, O men, the proclamation; Cease from vanity and strife. Hasten to receive the gospel And obey the words of life, And obey, and obey the words of life.
Soon the earth will hear the warning; Then the judgments will descend! Oh, before the days of sorrow, Make the Lord of Hosts your friend! Make the Lord, make the Lord of Hosts your friend!
Then when dangers are around you And the wicked are distressed, You, with all the Saints of Zion, Shall enjoy eternal rest, Shall enjoy, shall enjoy eternal rest.

title: Oh Say, What Is Truth? (Menâs Choir)
lyrics: Oh say, what is truth? âTis the fairest gem That the riches of worlds can produce, And priceless the value of truth will be when The proud monarchâs costliest diadem Is counted but dross and refuse.

Yes, say, what is truth? âTis the brightest prize To which mortals or Gods can aspire. Go search in the depths where it glittering lies, Or ascend in pursuit to the loftiest skies: âTis an aim for the noblest desire.

The sceptre may fall from the despotâs grasp When with winds of stern justice he copes. But the pillar of truth will endure to the last, And its firm-rooted bulwarks outstand the rude blast And the wreck of the fell tyrantâs hopes.

Then say, what is truth? âTis the last and the first, For the limits of time it steps oâer. Tho the heavens depart and the earthâs fountains burst, Truth, the sum of existence, will weather the worst, Eternal, unchanged, evermore.

title: Come, O Thou King of Kings (Menâs Choir)
lyrics: Come, O thou King of Kings! Weâve waited long for thee, With healing in thy wings, To set thy people free. Come, thou desire of nations, come; Let Israel now be gathered home.
Come, make an end to sin, And cleanse the earth by fire, And righteousness bring in, That Saints may tune the lyre With songs of joy, a happier strain, To welcome in thy peaceful reign.
Hosannas now shall sound From all the ransomed throng, And glory echo round A new triumphal song; The wide expanse of heaven fill With anthems sweet from Zionâs hill.
Hail! Prince of life and peace! Thrice welcome to thy throne! While all the chosen race Their Lord and Savior own, The heathen nations bow the knee, And evâry tongue sounds praise to thee.

title: High on the Mountain Top (Menâs Choir)
lyrics: High on the mountain top A banner is unfurled. Ye nations, now look up; It waves to all the world. In Deseretâs sweet, peaceful land, On Zionâs mount behold it stand!
For God remembers still His promise made of old That he on Zionâs hill Truthâs standard would unfold! Her light should there attract the gaze Of all the world in latter days.
His house shall there be reared, His glory to display, And people shall be heard In distant lands to say: Weâll now go up and serve the Lord, Obey his truth and learn his word.
For there we shall be taught The law that will go forth, With truth and wisdom fraught, To govern all the earth. Forever there his ways weâll tread, And save ourselves with all our dead.

title: I Need Thee Every Hour (Menâs Choir)
lyrics: I need thee every hour, Most gracious Lord. No tender voice like thine Can peace afford. I need thee, oh, I need thee; Every hour I need thee! Oh, bless me now, my Savior; I come to thee!
I need thee every hour; Stay thou nearby. Temptations lose their powâr When thou art nigh. I need thee, oh, I need thee; Every hour I need thee! Oh, bless me now, my Savior; I come to thee!
I need thee every hour, In joy or pain. Come quickly and abide, Or life is vain. I need thee, oh, I need thee; Every hour I need thee! Oh, bless me now, my Savior; I come to thee!
I need thee every hour, Most holy One. Oh, make me thine indeed, Thou blessed Son! I need thee, oh, I need thee; Every hour I need thee! Oh, bless me now, my Savior; I come to thee!

title: Brightly Beams Our Fatherâs Mercy (Menâs Choir)
lyrics: Brightly beams our Fatherâs mercy From his lighthouse evermore, But to us he gives the keeping Of the lights along the shore. Let the lower lights be burning; Send a gleam across the wave. Some poor fainting, struggling seaman You may rescue, you may save.

Dark the night of sin has settled; Loud the angry billows roar. Eager eyes are watching, longing, For the lights along the shore. Let the lower lights be burning; Send a gleam across the wave. Some poor fainting, struggling seaman You may rescue, you may save.

Trim your feeble lamp, my brother; Some poor sailor, tempest-tossed, Trying now to make the harbor, In the darkness may be lost. Let the lower lights be burning; Send a gleam across the wave. Some poor fainting, struggling seaman You may rescue, you may save.

title: School Thy Feelings (Menâs Choir)
lyrics: School thy feelings, O my brother; Train thy warm, impulsive soul. Do not its emotions smother, But let wisdomâs voice control. School thy feelings; there is power In the cool, collected mind. Passion shatters reasonâs tower, Makes the clearest vision blind. School thy feelings, O my brother; Train thy warm, impulsive soul. Do not its emotions smother, But let wisdomâs voice control.

School thy feelings; condemnation Never pass on friend or foe, Though the tide of accusation Like a flood of truth may flow. Hear defense before deciding, And a ray of light may gleam, Showing thee what filth is hiding Underneath the shallow stream. School thy feelings, O my brother; Train thy warm, impulsive soul. Do not its emotions smother, But let wisdomâs voice control.

Should afflictionâs acrid vial Burst oâer thy unsheltered head, School thy feelings to the trial; Half its bitterness hath fled. Art thou falsely, basely, slandered? Does the world begin to frown? Gauge thy wrath by wisdomâs standard; Keep thy rising anger down. School thy feelings, O my brother; Train thy warm, impulsive soul. Do not its emotions smother, But let wisdomâs voice control.

Rest thyself on this assurance: Timeâs a friend to innocence, And the patient, calm endurance Wins respect and aids defense. Noblest minds have finest feelings; Quivâring strings a breath can move; And the gospelâs sweet revealings Tune them with the key of love. School thy feelings, O my brother; Train thy warm, impulsive soul. Do not its emotions smother, But let wisdomâs voice control.

Hearts so sensitively molded Strongly fortified should be, Trained to firmness and enfolded In a calm tranquility. Wound not willfully another; Conquer haste with reasonâs might; School thy feelings, sister, brother; Train them in the path of right. School thy feelings, O my brother; Train thy warm, impulsive soul. Do not its emotions smother, But let wisdomâs voice control.

title: O Home Beloved (Menâs Choir)
lyrics: O home belovâd, whereâer I wander, On foreign land or distant sea, As time rolls by, my heart grows fonder And yearns more lovingly for thee! Tho fair be natureâs scenes around me, And friends are ever kind and true, Tho joyous mirth and song surround me, My heart, my soul still yearn for you.

The flowârs around me may be fairer Than those that bloom upon thy hills; The streams, great, mighty treasure bearers, More noted may be than thy rills. No world renown my humble village Like these great towns may proudly claim; Yet my fond heart doth thrill with rapture Wheneâer I hear thy humble name.

Ye valleys fair and snowcapped mountains, Ye peaceful hamlets âmid the trees, Ye murmâring streams and crystal fountains, Kissed by the cool, soft, balmy breeze, Words cannot tell how well I love thee Nor speak my longing when I roam. My heart alone can cry to heaven, âGod bless my own dear mountain home.â

title: America the Beautiful
lyrics: Oh, beautiful for spacious skies, For amber waves of grain, For purple mountain majesties Above the fruited plain! America! America! God shed his grace on thee, And crown thy good with brotherhood From sea to shining sea.

Oh, beautiful for pilgrim feet, Whose stern, impassioned stress A thoroughfare of freedom beat Across the wilderness! America! America! God mend thine evâry flaw, Confirm thy soul in self-control, Thy liberty in law.

Oh, beautiful for heroes proved In liberating strife, Who more than self their country loved, And mercy more than life! America! America! May God thy gold refine, Till all success be nobleness, And evâry gain divine.

Oh, beautiful for patriot dream That sees beyond the years Thine alabaster cities gleam, Undimmed by human tears! America! America! God shed his grace on thee, And crown thy good with brotherhood From sea to shining sea.

title: My Country, âTis of Thee
lyrics: My country, âtis of thee, Sweet land of liberty, Of thee I sing; Land where my fathers died, Land of the pilgrimsâ pride, From evâry mountainside Let freedom ring!
My native country, thee, Land of the noble free, Thy name I love; I love thy rocks and rills, Thy woods and templed hills. My heart with rapture thrills Like that above.
Let music swell the breeze And ring from all the trees Sweet freedomâs song; Let mortal tongues awake; Let all that breathe partake; Let rocks their silence break, The sound prolong.
Our fathersâ God, to thee, Author of liberty, To thee we sing; Long may our land be bright With freedomâs holy light. Protect us by thy might, Great God, our King!

title: The Star-Spangled Banner
lyrics: Oh say, can you see, by the dawnâs early light, What so proudly we hailed at the twilightâs last gleaming, Whose broad stripes and bright stars, through the perilous fight, Oâer the ramparts we watched, were so gallantly streaming? And the rocketsâ red glare, the bombs bursting in air, Gave proof thru the night that our flag was still there. Oh say, does that star-spangled banner yet wave Oâer the land of the free and the home of the brave?

On the shore, dimly seen thru the mists of the deep, Where the foeâs haughty host in dread silence reposes, What is that which the breeze, oâer the towering steep, As it fitfully blows, half conceals, half discloses? Now it catches the gleam of the morningâs first beam, In full glory reflected now shines on the stream; âTis the star-spangled banner! Oh, long may it wave Oâer the land of the free and the home of the brave!

Oh, thus be it ever, when free men shall stand Between their loved homes and the warâs desolation! Blest with victâry and peace, may the heavân-rescued land Praise the Powâr that hath made and preserved us a nation! Then conquer we must, when our cause it is just, And this be our motto: âIn God is our trust!â And the star-spangled banner in triumph shall wave Oâer the land of the free and the home of the brave!

title: God Save the King
lyrics: God save our gracious king! Long live our noble king! God save the king! Send him victorious, Happy and glorious, Long to reign over us; God save the king!
Thy choicest gifts in store On him be pleased to pour; Long may he reign! May he defend our laws, And ever give us cause To sing with heart and voice, God save the king!

title: The Morning Breaks
lyrics: The morning breaks, the shadows flee; Lo, Zionâs standard is unfurled! The dawning of a brighter day, The dawning of a brighter day Majestic rises on the world.
The clouds of error disappear Before the rays of truth divine; The glory bursting from afar, The glory bursting from afar Wide oâer the nations soon will shine.
The Gentile fulness now comes in, And Israelâs blessings are at hand. Lo, Judahâs remnant, cleansed from sin, Lo, Judahâs remnant, cleansed from sin, Shall in their promised Canaan stand.
Jehovah speaks! Let earth give ear, And Gentile nations turn and live. His mighty arm is making bare, His mighty arm is making bare His covânant people to receive.
âAngels from heavân and truth from earth Have met, and both have record borne; Thus Zionâs light is bursting forth, Thus Zionâs light is bursting forth To bring her ransomed children home.
